answers.answer: Hello,These are types of congenital heart defects that may occur spontaneously, may be associated with a chromosomal abnormality,  or be related to an exposure (to a drug/toxin) in early pregnancy, while some can be related to maternal disease such as poorly controlled diabetes, and others are passed down genetically.  I suggest you speak with a pediatric cardiologist to get more specific information regarding your concerns.  Additionally, if you google any of those terms there will be a wealth of information on line for you to review.Best regards,Dr. Downing
My husband has heart problems,  did you find out if any of these would be passed on from his side/ what are they?

question: what causes this in pregnancy. I would like to more about these.Hypoplastic left heart syndromeDexrracordiaInferior Vena Cava Interruption
title: grandbaby
